comment._content: Besides of that, I think now that the man on this photo has much more similarity to Robert Bacon (July 5, 1860 – May 29, 1919), American statesman and diplomat (he served as United States Ambassador to France from 1909 until 1912) (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Bacon) and the LOC title is wrong. He was the father of Robert Low Bacon. On November 4, 1915 Bacon (the former ambassador) went to Europe in connection with the work of the American Ambulance Hospital in Paris and also in connection with the service of the Harvard surgical unit (The Washington times., November 05, 1915, HOME EDITION, Page 15, column 1). He came back in December, see above. Another report of the arrival of R. Bacon, the former ambassador, in the Bismarck daily tribune., December 30, 1915, Image 5, column 5.

comment._content: Yes, no question this is the elder Robert Bacon, not the son Robert Low Bacon. Good catch.
